answers.answer: Hi, I don't have diabetes, but I do have a nerve condition that causes me to have cold hands and feet, and decreased sensation in both.  In diabetics this is often the result of diabetic neuropathy.Do you have a good doctor?  Do you test your blood sugar?  Low blood sugar could cause the shakiness when you wake, I'm pretty sure.  Do you get blood work done, like testing your thyroid function, CBC, and all that good stuff?  Have you talked to a doctor about your weight loss and stomach pain after eating?It's a good idea to ask because I've found that all the symptoms a person has isn't necessarily related to the biggest health issue they're dealing with.  I have multiple sclerosis, but I also have reflux disease, arthritis, restless leg syndrome, and more.  A good doctor can help you figure it all out and hopefully help you deal with everything.I think a lot of these questions could better be answered by your doctor than by me (obviously, ha ha), but you asked here so I'm trying to help a little.  I know how scary and frustrating all sorts of strange symptoms can be.Take care.
